text: Cleotha Lemon, Jr. (born August 16, 1979) is an American football coach and former professional football quarterback. He is the wide receivers coach for the Jackson State Gamecocks. He played for parts of 3 years in the National Football League (NFL). He played for the San Diego Chargers, Miami Dolphins, Baltimore Ravens and Jacksonville Jaguars. He also played for the Toronto Argonauts of the Canadian Football League (CFL) and the Memphis Xplorers of the AF2. He started playing in the NFL for the Baltimore Ravens in 2002. Lemon played for the San Diego Chargers from 2003 to 2005. He then played for the Miami Dolphins until the 2007 season. He played for the Jacksonville Jaguars in 2008 before being cut from the team. He joined the Toronto Argonauts of Canadian Football League (CFL) and played for them from March 17, 2010 until he was released on September 6, 2011. He played college football at Arkansas State. Lemon retired from playing professional football in 2011. ==References== ==Other websites== *Profile on NFL.com Category:1979 births Category:Living people Category:African-American players of American football Category:American football quarterbacks Category:Baltimore Ravens players Category:Jacksonville Jaguars players Category:Miami Dolphins players Category:San Diego Chargers players Category:Toronto Argonauts players Category:Sportspeople from Mississippi
title: Cleo Lemon
